page.title: 10THE GARTH PROJECT:S.TYNESIDE
page.content: The Garth Project was started in 1977 at the South Tyneside College.It is designed to help the mentally and physically handicapped aged between 16-19years.The students come mostly from the three special schools in the town.The Garth Project teaches the students the basic skills to enable them to get a job in bricklaying,joinery,cookery,gardening, woodwork,art,beekeeping and metalwork.Each student trains for a 12 month period which can be extended to 18 months.The students are taught in groups of 30 and are taught at West Garth Village.Before 1977 the grounds belonged to a convent run by the 'Sisters Of Mercy.'Although neglected the students soon had them restored and have since won prizes and awards.At present they are building a pavilion to sell tea and biscuits.
